meanings.definition: To give shape or structure to something.
meanings.sent1: She formed a clay pot in art class.
meanings.sent2: The artist formed a beautiful sculpture out of marble.
meanings.sent3: The children formed a line to go to the playground.
meanings.sent4: His ideas formed the basis of the new project.
meanings.sent5: The baker formed the dough into perfect circles for the cookies.

meanings.definition: To come into existence or be created.
meanings.sent1: A plan formed in her mind to solve the problem.
meanings.sent2: The stars formed in the vast expanse of space.
meanings.sent3: The friendship formed between the two classmates over time.
meanings.sent4: The idea formed like a storm brewing in his thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The story formed gradually in the writer's imagination.

meanings.definition: To be made up of something.
meanings.sent1: The necklace was formed of shiny pearls.
meanings.sent2: The cake was formed from layers of sponge and cream.
meanings.sent3: The team was formed of players from different schools.
meanings.sent4: The planet was formed by swirling gases and dust.
meanings.sent5: The wall was formed of bricks stacked neatly on top of each other.

meanings.sent1: The storm clouds formed in the sky, signaling rain.
meanings.sent2: The idea formed gradually as they discussed it further.
meanings.sent3: The plan formed perfectly after considering all options.
meanings.sent4: The friendship formed quickly between the two neighbors.
meanings.sent5: The flower garden formed beautifully with each bloom opening up.
